title: Parallel Learning Framework for Solving Zero-Sum Games in Nonlinear Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of game theory, basic mathematical operations proficiency, and computer literacy
context.additional_context: Learners experience strategic decision-making and collaborative problem-solving within social studies contexts. Nonlinear system concepts are simplified via gamified approaches, with real-world case applications.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the fundamental principles of nonlinear systems through game theory.
Using a parallel learning framework, learners can explore optimal strategies in zero-sum games.
Learners can predict and optimize approximations of cost functions using exploration policies.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
